subject: RE: [junit] Commons Logging, Log4J and JUnit
msgSnippet: Also, what do you see what you add a line to your log4j.properties file that says: log4j.debug=true ? You should see extra debugging output in this case which
messageBody:
Also, what do you see what you add a line to your log4j.properties file
that says:

log4j.debug=true

?

You should see extra debugging output in this case which will help you
debug your configuration problem.


Todd.
ps. This really isn't a JUnit issue. This is the kind of question that
pops up every day on the log4j email list
(log4j-user@...).

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of CAKALIC, JAMES P [AG-Contractor/1000]
> Sent: Wednesday, December 14, 2005 9:27 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] Commons Logging, Log4J and JUnit
>
> Where is your log4j.properties file? It needs to be
> accessible on the classpath. Alternatively, you can specify
> its location explicitly by setting the /log4j.configuration/
> System property.
>
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com]
> On Behalf Of
> >Rob Sanheim
> >Sent: Wednesday, December 14, 2005 9:48 AM
> >To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> >Subject: Re: [junit] Commons Logging, Log4J and JUnit
> >
> >On 12/13/05, chrlsberger <charles@...> wrote:
> >> I am writing some unit test classes for a project I'm
> working on. I
> >> use Apache Commons Logging as a wrapper for Log4J but I
> keep getting
> >> the following error messages when I run the tests:
> >>
> >> log4j:WARN No appenders could be found for logger
> >> (com.panoramicsolutions.ffl.model.HibernateConfiguration).
> >> log4j:WARN Please initialize the log4j system properly.
> >>
> snip
> >>
> >> I have tried the following to get this working:
> >>
> >> 1) including log4j.properties on the classpath
> >> 2) removing it from the classpath and specifying
> >> -Dlog4j.properties=<full path to file> on the Java command line
> >>
> >> I also had to edit the Junit excluded.properties file to exclude
> >> org.apache.commons.logging.* to get this far.
> >>
> >> In the classes I define the Log variables as follows:
> >>
> >> private static Log logger = Logger.getLog(<classname>.class);
> >>
> >> This is really doing my head in as I can't see the log messages to
> >> help debug a problem in the Hibernate configuration. Despite
> >> spending hours searching the web and newsgroups for an
> answer I can't find one.
> >>
> >> Can anyone help?
> >>
> >> Thanks,
> >>
> >> Charles.
> >
> >Charles:
> >
> >(This should really be on a log4j list, but oh well...)
> >
> >
> >I think this is because you are setting your root log level to info:
> >log4j.rootLogger=info, stdout, file
> >
> >Whereas your app logs are set to debug - so they don't have
> an appender
> >to go to. Have you tried setting the root level to debug?
> >- Rob
> >
